sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• each vial containing colistimethate sodium (pentasodium colistin-methanesulfonate) is equivalent to 150 mg of colistin base activity; colistin base 1 mg = colistimethate sodium 2.4 mg OR 30,000 International Units; colistimethate sodium 1 mg = 12,500 International Units
  • Disease due to Gram-negative bacteria, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Enterobacter aerogenes, Escherichia coli, and Klebsiella pneumoniae: 2.5 to 5 mg/kg per day of colistin base IM or IV in 2 to 4 divided doses, depending on severity of infection; MAX 5 mg/kg/day based on colistin base activity

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono:
• each vial containing colistimethate sodium (pentasodium colistin-methanesulfonate) is equivalent to 150 mg of colistin base activity; colistin base 1 mg = colistimethate sodium 2.4 mg OR 30,000 International Units; colistimethate sodium 1 mg = 12,500 International Units
  • Disease due to Gram-negative bacteria, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Enterobacter aerogenes, Escherichia coli, and Klebsiella pneumoniae: 2.5 to 5 mg/kg per day of colistin base IM or IV in 2 to 4 divided doses, depending on severity of infection; MAX 5 mg/kg/day based on colistin base activity

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• renal impairment (adults), mild (CrCl 50 to 79 mL/min), 2.5 to 3.8 mg/kg/day of colistin base IM or IV in 2 divided doses
  • renal impairment (adults), moderate (CrCl 30 to 49 mL/min), 2.5 mg/kg/day of colistin base IM or IV once daily or in 2 divided doses
  • renal impairment (adults), severe (CrCl 10 to 29 mL/min), 1.5 mg/kg/day of colistin base IM or IV every 36 hours
  • obesity, determine dose based on ideal body weight

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Disease due to Gram-negative bacteria, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Enterobacter aerogenes, Escherichia coli, and Klebsiella pneumoniae

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: history of sensitivity to colistimethate or its components

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Clostridium difficile-associated diarrhea, including mild diarrhea to fatal colitis, has been reported; may occur more than 2 months after administration; if suspected or confirmed, discontinue any ongoing antibiotic therapy
  • inhalation therapy; acute respiratory failure may result when reconstituted colistimethate solution is not used promptly; after reconstitution, colistimethate is hydrolyzed to form active components, including polymyxin E1, which has shown to cause localized inflammation of the airway epithelia and eosinophilic infiltration
  • nephrotoxicity; reversible and dose-dependent manifestations may occur
  • neurological disturbances, transient (eg, circumoral paresthesia or numbness, tingling or formication of the extremities, generalized pruritus, vertigo, dizziness, and slurring of speech), may occur; dosage adjustment may be necessary
  • renal impairment; increased risk of apnea and neuromuscular blockade; dosage adjustment recommended
  • respiratory arrest has been reported after IM administration

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Serious
  • Gastrointestinal:Clostridium difficile diarrhea
  • Neurologic:Neurological muscular paralysis
  • Renal:Nephrotoxicity (31%)
  • Respiratory:Respiratory failure, Respiratory tract paralysis

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Colistimethate sodium, a polypeptide antibiotic, penetrates and disrupts the bacterial cell membrane of susceptible strains of aerobic gram-negative bacteria.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Tmax, IM: 1 to 2 hour
  • Tmax, IV: 30 to 60 minutes
  • Bioavailability, Oral: not absorbed
  • Bioavailability, IM: well-absorbed

sub.title: Distribution
sub.mono:
• Vd, cystic fibrosis: 0.34 L/kg
  • Vd, renal failure: 10.9 L to 27 L

sub.title: Metabolism
sub.mono:
• Plasma: 31.2% hydrolyzed to sulfomethylated derivatives and colistin
  • Colistin: active

sub.title: Excretion
sub.mono:
• Renal: approximately 60% unchanged
  • Dialyzable: Unknown (hemodialysis)
  • Dialyzable: Yes (peritoneal), insignificant amount
  • Hemofiltration: Yes, 20.3% colistimethate sodium, 6.88% colistin
  • Total body clearance, critically ill: 0.26 L/hr/kg
  • Total body clearance, cystic fibrosis: 2 mL/min/kg

sub.title: Elimination Half Life
sub.mono:
• Adults, children, 2 to 3 hour
  • Renal impairment, up to 2 to 3 days

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    • reconstitute 150 mg (colistin base) vial with 2 mL sterile water for injection for a resulting concentration of 75 mg/mL colistin base; swirl gently to avoid frothing
    • IV administration is preferred because of severe pain at the injection site caused by IM administration
  • Inhalation
    administer inhalation treatment promptly after colistimethate for injection is reconstituted; storing colistimethate aqueous solution for longer than 24 hours increases colistin concentration and increases the potential for lung toxicity
  • Intramuscular
    • administer by deep IM injection into large muscle mass (eg, gluteal muscles or lateral portion of thigh)
    • IV administration is preferred over IM administration.
  • Intravenous
    • (continuous infusion) slowly inject one-half of the total daily dose over 3 to 5 minutes; add remaining half to NS, D5NS, D5W, D5-0.45%NaCl, D5-0.225%NaCl, LR, or 10% invert sugar solution and infuse over 22 to 23 hours, starting 1 to 2 hours after initial dose; decrease infusion rate based on degree of renal impairment; use infusion solution within 24 hours
    • (direct intermittent administration) slowly inject one-half of the total daily dose over 3 to 5 minutes every 12 hours

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• cultures and sensitivities
  • CBC
  • symptomatic improvement
  • temperature
  • renal function
  • signs and symptoms of neuromuscular blockade

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Generic
    Injection Powder for Solution: 150 MG
  • Coly-Mycin M Parenteral
    Injection Powder for Solution: 150 MG

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patient against driving or performing hazardous tasks during therapy, as drug can cause tingling of extremities, vertigo, or dizziness.
  • Instruct patient to report watery or bloody diarrhea during therapy or up to several weeks post-therapy, and consult with healthcare professional prior to taking antidiarrheal medicine.
  • Drug may cause rash, fever, gastrointestinal disturbances or transient neurological symptoms (circumoral paresthesia or numbness, pruritus, slurred speech).
  • Instruct patient to report symptoms of nephrotoxicity, decreased urinary output, or respiratory distress.
